newsitem.title: THAILAND: Thai baht up, interbank rate steady in late trade.
newsitem.headline: Thai baht up, interbank rate steady in late trade.

text.p: The Thai baht strengthened further against the dollar in late trade on Monday in line with the dollar's softness abroad, dealers said.
The baht firmed to 25.890/25.910 to the dollar late from 25.924/25.929 in the morning, dealers said.
"The dollar was under selling pressure here after it slipped sharply against the yen and mark," a dealer at a foreign bank said.
The improving baht sentiment and high local interest rates also sparked more interest in the baht, he added.
The Bank of Thailand fixed the mid-rate at 25.94 per dollar against 25.98 on Sunday.
The overnight interbank rate was steady at 13.00 percent, unchanged from early morning, dealers said.
Dealers said liquidity was tighter than on Friday due to higher fund demand to meet the central bank's next reserve requirement due on March 7.
The one-month baht/dollar swap premium was traded unchanged at 11.00/12.00 satangs per dollar late, dealers said.
